pr_title: [SQL] Support where, limit, order clause in show resourcestmt.

timeline.message:
[SQL] Support where, limit, order clause in show resourcestmt.

Grammar

    SHOW RESOURCES
    [
        WHERE
        [NAME [ = "your_resource_name" | LIKE "name_matcher"]]
        [RESOURCETYPE = ["SPARK"]]
    ]
    [ORDER BY ...]
    [LIMIT limit][OFFSET offset];

issue #4501

timeline.bodyText:
the ResourceType has two definations but has different meanings：
1、org.apache.doris.catalog.Resource.ResourceType
2、org.apache.doris.catalog.ResourceType
should be fix
timeline.author: wutiangan

replies.bodyText: org.apache.doris.catalog.ResourceType is deprecated. It will be deleted in the future
replies.author: HappenLee

timeline.author: wutiangan

replies.bodyText: There is need need ignore. The Name should be case sensitive
replies.author: HappenLee

timeline.author: wutiangan

timeline.bodyText:
Better don't use 'key' annd 'value' because they are keywords in doris.
For example , show resources where name like "test" and resourcetype = "spark" order by KEY; will report an error
timeline.author: xy720

replies.bodyText:
Hi,xy720. I keep the older name of the Resource. The key and value is the keyword in doris. The only way to use it is to add operator ` to prevent the error of doris.
Maybe we should change the name.
replies.author: HappenLee

timeline.bodyText:
Why changing them to uppercase?
And as @xy720 said, better not using KEY, I prefer Item.
timeline.author: morningman
